text: {"answer":"D","reasoning":"iii is incorrect because classical Roman law generally required animus (knowledge/intent) for possessio; the treasure-on-another’s-land issue is more about acquisition/ownership (thesaurus), not “possession without knowledge.” v is incorrect because posters/TV spots in an official information campaign are typically not individual, binding administrative decisions (Verfügungen) and thus are not directly appealable as such. Statements i, ii, and iv are correct in their general form."}
